text: Salomón Jaar Welchez (1962 – 4 April 2010) was the presidential commissioner for Southern Honduras. He had previously served in many positions in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church). He died as a result of chest wounds received in an assault by robbers who waylaid his vehicle in Guatemala on a trip he was taking with his wife and daughter to the LDS Church's Guatemala City Guatemala Temple. Jaar joined the LDS Church at age 18. He served as a Mormon missionary in Guatemala. He later worked as a coordinator for the Church Educational System. Jaar was the first president of the LDS Church's Valle de Sula Honduras Stake. He later served as an area seventy and as president of the Honduras Tegucigalpa Mission of the church. He had also served as a bishop in the LDS Church. Jaar was mission president from 1993 to 1996 and an area seventy from 1996 to 2000. At the time of his death he was the bishop of the Tamarindo Ward in the Choluteca Honduras Stake.Church News, April 24, 2010, p. 13 Jaar wrote the book Quieres Ser Rico?. ==References== ==Further reading== *Latin American Herald article on Jaar's death *article on Jaar's death *Deseret News, April 16, 2010 *news source on Jaar's death *author listing for Jaar Category:1962 births Category:Converts to Mormonism Category:Honduran leaders of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Category:Honduran Mormon missionaries Category:Mormon missionaries in Honduras Category:Mormon missionaries in Guatemala Category:Church Educational System instructors Category:Mission presidents (LDS Church) Category:Area seventies (LDS Church) Category:20th-century Mormon missionaries Category:2010 deaths Category:Honduran people murdered abroad Category:People murdered in Guatemala Category:Honduran expatriates in Guatemala
title: Salomón Jaar
